definition: lit. cries of grief shake the heavens/great sorrow (idiom)

sentences.english: Laurier : I never forgot her cry.
I walked to the locked door, the sounds of the crying becoming louder.
sentences.chinese: 我走到鎖着的那扇門前，哭聲變得更清楚了。

sentences.english: Suddenly, the music of the piano disappears, then wail appears.
sentences.chinese: 忽然，琴聲消失了，淒厲的哭聲又跟著出現。

sentences.english: Silence is a girl's loudest cry.
sentences.chinese: 沉默是一個暐女孩最大的哭聲。

sentences.english: The baby's crying jangled my nerves.
sentences.chinese: 嬰兒的哭聲讓我十分心煩。

sentences.english: Then the wailing and the touch of the ghosts would pass on and his horse would move again.
sentences.chinese: 隨後哭聲消失了，鬼魂也走開了，馬又繼續向前走。

sentences.english: Sharp ground cry a voice, even appear to cry piteously of cry a voice.
sentences.chinese: 尖銳的哭聲，甚至出現哀嚎的哭聲。

sentences.english: Sharp ground cry a voice, even appear to cry piteously of cry a voice.
sentences.chinese: 尖銳的哭聲，甚至出現哀嚎的哭聲。

sentences.english: I wanted to cry also because I felt tired and his cry was so irritating.
sentences.chinese: 我也非常想哭，因爲我非常累並且他的哭聲很招人煩。

sentences.english: The baby with the loudest howls is declared the winner by the sumo judge.
sentences.chinese: 哭聲最響亮的嬰兒被評委宣佈爲比賽冠軍。

sentences.english: Suddenly, he heard the tiny sobs of his son.
sentences.chinese: 突然間，他聽到了兒子低低的哭聲。

sentences.english: Pirates happened to be outside,they hear her crying, and they break into the tomb.
sentences.chinese: 海盜正好在外面，他們聽到她的哭聲，他們砸開墳墓。

sentences.english: I play music loudly, you can't hear me cry.
sentences.chinese: 我把音樂開到很大聲，才聽不到我撕心裂肺的哭聲。

sentences.english: Grievous tears cast some stalactites, spreading out crying.
sentences.chinese: 悲淚凝鑄的鐘乳迸濺着哭聲。

sentences.english: I opened it with a creak, and the crying stopped.
sentences.chinese: 門吱嘎一聲打開了，哭聲也停了。

sentences.english: Though staying in the room next door, I can still hear her low sobs.
sentences.chinese: 雖然在隔壁房間，可還能聽到她幽咽的哭聲。

definition: yelling (sound made by person)/barking/braying/roaring (sound made by animals)
to lose one's voice/(to cry out) involuntarily
to cry out/to bark out a sound
to rouse/to be woken by sth/to wake with a start/to sleep lightly
first tone in Mandarin (high, level tone)
in a low voice/(speak) in whispers
